		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=97957&sid=8a5f9d063a9ebd5e137d60e1d6b76f39#97957"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Fri Jun 03, 2005 11:05 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=97957&sid=8a5f9d063a9ebd5e137d60e1d6b76f39"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">You don't need to animate with bones to use der_ton's general MD5 exporter, but that's for 3ds Max.<br/>_________________<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://trepaning.com/" target="_blank" class="postlink">Good Bye!</a></span><span class="gensmall"/></td>

post.date: Posted: Sun May 22, 2005 7:53 pm Post subject:
post.author: Oneofthe8devilz
post.body:
Is there a way to attach a sound sapeaker to a md5's origin bone ?

I have a scene where a f-16 jet is flying through the level (animated in 3dsmax and exported to md5) and I would like to add some jet engine sounds to it that move with the jet....... just binding the speaker to the model-entity's name didn't do the trick since the entity itself is not moving .........

Thanks for some suggestions in advance

There's probably a way to bind the speaker though, since there is a way to bind the flashlight to a zombie's hand.

post.date: Posted: Sun May 22, 2005 8:58 pm Post subject:
post.author: BloodRayne
post.body:
Oneofthe8devilz wrote:
Is there a way to attach a sound sapeaker to a md5's origin bone ?


You don't need to, since it's an entity you can just call the sound from the animation def. An example:

Code:

model model_myf16 {
   mesh   models/md5/my_f16.md5mesh

   anim fly   models/md5/my_f16_fly.md5anim {
                frame 1   sound_body snd_fly
   }


snd_fly is then just a sounddecls you can define anywhere as soundshader.
_________________
Hexen Edge Of Chaos
Download the Ultimate Mod

Personal websites:
http://pixels.ontheweb.nl

post.date: Posted: Sun May 22, 2005 9:22 pm Post subject:
post.author: Oneofthe8devilz
post.body:
Quote:
You don't need to, since it's an entity you can just call the sound from the animation def. An example:

Code:

model model_myf16 {
mesh models/md5/my_f16.md5mesh

anim fly models/md5/my_f16_fly.md5anim {
frame 1 sound_body snd_fly
}



snd_fly is then just a sounddecls you can define anywhere as soundshader.



Actually I got it working by looking closer at the "cinematics.def" file a couple of hours ago..... I was just so amazed by the fact that I got it working that I forgot to post you guys ........

Still thanks for that quick response bloodrayne ......

That's how I solved the problem:


Code:
model f16_jet {
   mesh      models/chris_md5/f16_jet.md5mesh   
   anim f16flyby   models/chris_md5/f16_jet.md5anim {
   frame 1      sound f16_jet_engine
   }
}

entityDef f16_jet {      
      "inherit"   "func_animate"
      "model"      "f16_jet"
}


"f16_jet_engine" is a looped soundshader that starts to play at frame 1 and gets played by the origin bone by default.... you can also define in the entity which bone shall play the sound.........

So once started it plays it infinitive times back......

I hope this might wind up useful for other ppl aswell......
_________________

Check out my mods:
eCoop and 5.56mm Full Metal Jacket...

post.date: Posted: Fri Jun 03, 2005 7:16 am Post subject:
post.author: bad marine ass
post.body:
Ok guys I have a bit of a problem with animation. My knowledge is almost at 0, but I understand in theory how it works

Take a look at this screenshot


Now what I want to do is to make the trigger move. The tension of the rope is released and the rope is moved forward, and then the bolt will also move forward with lightning speed and push the bolt (which isnt present in the screenshot) out of the crossbow

I have 2 questions:

1) my crossbow is made up of 7-8 different layers of parts ie. trigger in one layer, handle in one layer etc, do I need to combine them?
2) How do I actually get the crossbow to behave in the above-mentioned way? Any help will be appreciated. I've been reading the tutorials, and I've heard of the motion mixer plugin and stuff like that, but I'm very confused as to how I should get myself orientated and started with this

post.date: Posted: Fri Jun 03, 2005 8:53 am Post subject:
post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body:
Well if you have any intention of exporting that weapon to Doom 3 then you'd best forget all the special animation tools Lightwave affords you and stick to using bones because bone transformations are the only transformations that can be stored in a MD5anim.

Aside from that you'll probably need to merge all the layers aswell.
_________________
Staff
Learn something today? Why not write an article about it on modwiki.net?

You don't need to animate with bones to use der_ton's general MD5 exporter, but that's for 3ds Max.

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
I think it's best if you try out the process of getting an animated model from LW into D3 with an example, instead of putting lots of time into animating your model with the wrong methods, walking down a long road just to see it's a dead end.

post.date: Posted: Sat Jun 04, 2005 2:20 pm Post subject:
post.author: Fingernail
post.body:
Although we need animators (Dark Mod), we're probably not the MOST at need. We have a couple of people at least capable of animating, and we've got about three animations in on a couple of characters (walking, running, punching), but it's great to see the community recognising this "problem".

Depending on how things go, we may need your help, but with us it's a case of, we have a couple of people who CAN do animations, it's just that they also have a helluva lot of models to do and don't have the time to ONLY do animations, etc. etc. We're just about to go on a bit of an "advertising campaign" searching for animators, actually.

<!--
/*
  The original subSilver Theme for phpBB version 2+
  Created by subBlue design
  /web/20070509181516/http://www.subblue.com

  NOTE: These CSS definitions are stored within the main page body so that you can use the phpBB2
  theme administration centre. When you have finalised your style you could cut the final CSS code
  and place it in an external file, deleting this section to save bandwidth.
*/

/* General page style. The scroll bar colours only visible in IE5.5+ */
body {
	background-color: #E5E5E5;
	scrollbar-face-color: #DEE3E7;
	scrollbar-highlight-color: #FFFFFF;
	scrollbar-shadow-color: #DEE3E7;
	scrollbar-3dlight-color: #D1D7DC;
	scrollbar-arrow-color:  #006699;
	scrollbar-track-color: #EFEFEF;
	scrollbar-darkshadow-color: #98AAB1;
}

/* General font families for common tags */
font,th,td,p { font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif }
a:link,a:active,a:visited { color : #006699; }
a:hover		{ text-decoration: underline; color : #DD6900; }
hr	{ height: 0px; border: solid #D1D7DC 0px; border-top-width: 1px;}

/* This is the border line & background colour round the entire page */
.bodyline	{ background-color: #FFFFFF; border: 1px #98AAB1 solid; }

/* This is the outline round the main forum tables */
.forumline	{ background-color: #FFFFFF; border: 2px #006699 solid; }

/* Main table cell colours and backgrounds */
td.row1	{ background-color: #EFEFEF; }
td.row2	{ background-color: #DEE3E7; }
td.row3	{ background-color: #D1D7DC; }

/*
  This is for the table cell above the Topics, Post & Last posts on the index.php page
  By default this is the fading out gradiated silver background.
  However, you could replace this with a bitmap specific for each forum
*/
td.rowpic {
		background-color: #FFFFFF;
		background-image: url(https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/cellpic2.jpg);
		background-repeat: repeat-y;
}

/* Header cells - the blue and silver gradient backgrounds */
th	{
	color: #FFA34F; font-size: 11px; font-weight : bold;
	background-color: #006699; height: 25px;
	background-image: url(https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/cellpic3.gif);
}

td.cat,td.catHead,td.catSides,td.catLeft,td.catRight,td.catBottom {
			background-image: url(https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/cellpic1.gif);
			background-color:#D1D7DC; border: #FFFFFF; border-style: solid; height: 28px;
}

/*
  Setting additional nice inner borders for the main table cells.
  The names indicate which sides the border will be on.
  Don't worry if you don't understand this, just ignore it :-)
*/
td.cat,td.catHead,td.catBottom {
	height: 29px;
	border-width: 0px 0px 0px 0px;
}
th.thHead,th.thSides,th.thTop,th.thLeft,th.thRight,th.thBottom,th.thCornerL,th.thCornerR {
	font-weight: bold; border: #FFFFFF; border-style: solid; height: 28px;
}
td.row3Right,td.spaceRow {
	background-color: #D1D7DC; border: #FFFFFF; border-style: solid;
}

th.thHead,td.catHead { font-size: 12px; border-width: 1px 1px 0px 1px; }
th.thSides,td.catSides,td.spaceRow	 { border-width: 0px 1px 0px 1px; }
th.thRight,td.catRight,td.row3Right	 { border-width: 0px 1px 0px 0px; }
th.thLeft,td.catLeft	  { border-width: 0px 0px 0px 1px; }
th.thBottom,td.catBottom  { border-width: 0px 1px 1px 1px; }
th.thTop	 { border-width: 1px 0px 0px 0px; }
th.thCornerL { border-width: 1px 0px 0px 1px; }
th.thCornerR { border-width: 1px 1px 0px 0px; }

/* The largest text used in the index page title and toptic title etc. */
.maintitle	{
	font-weight: bold; font-size: 22px; font-family: "Trebuchet MS",Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	text-decoration: none; line-height : 120%; color : #000000;
}

/* General text */
.gen { font-size : 12px; }
.genmed { font-size : 11px; }
.gensmall { font-size : 10px; }
.gen,.genmed,.gensmall { color : #000000; }
a.gen,a.genmed,a.gensmall { color: #006699; text-decoration: none; }
a.gen:hover,a.genmed:hover,a.gensmall:hover	{ color: #DD6900; text-decoration: underline; }

/* The register, login, search etc links at the top of the page */
.mainmenu		{ font-size : 11px; color : #000000 }
a.mainmenu		{ text-decoration: none; color : #006699;  }
a.mainmenu:hover{ text-decoration: underline; color : #DD6900; }

/* Forum category titles */
.cattitle		{ font-weight: bold; font-size: 12px ; letter-spacing: 1px; color : #006699}
a.cattitle		{ text-decoration: none; color : #006699; }
a.cattitle:hover{ text-decoration: underline; }

/* Forum title: Text and link to the forums used in: index.php */
.forumlink		{ font-weight: bold; font-size: 12px; color : #006699; }
a.forumlink 	{ text-decoration: none; color : #006699; }
a.forumlink:hover{ text-decoration: underline; color : #DD6900; }

/* Used for the navigation text, (Page 1,2,3 etc) and the navigation bar when in a forum */
.nav			{ font-weight: bold; font-size: 11px; color : #000000;}
a.nav			{ text-decoration: none; color : #006699; }
a.nav:hover		{ text-decoration: underline; }

/* titles for the topics: could specify viewed link colour too */
.topictitle,h1,h2	{ font-weight: bold; font-size: 11px; color : #000000; }
a.topictitle:link   { text-decoration: none; color : #006699; }
a.topictitle:visited { text-decoration: none; color : #5493B4; }
a.topictitle:hover	{ text-decoration: underline; color : #DD6900; }

/* Name of poster in viewmsg.php and viewtopic.php and other places */
.name			{ font-size : 11px; color : #000000;}

/* Location, number of posts, post date etc */
.postdetails		{ font-size : 10px; color : #000000; }

/* The content of the posts (body of text) */
.postbody { font-size : 12px; line-height: 18px}
a.postlink:link	{ text-decoration: none; color : #006699 }
a.postlink:visited { text-decoration: none; color : #5493B4; }
a.postlink:hover { text-decoration: underline; color : #DD6900}

/* Quote & Code blocks */
.code {
	font-family: Courier, 'Courier New', sans-serif; font-size: 11px; color: #006600;
	background-color: #FAFAFA; border: #D1D7DC; border-style: solid;
	border-left-width: 1px; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px
}

.quote {
	font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 11px; color: #444444; line-height: 125%;
	background-color: #FAFAFA; border: #D1D7DC; border-style: solid;
	border-left-width: 1px; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px
}

/* Copyright and bottom info */
.copyright		{ font-size: 10px; font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; color: #444444; letter-spacing: -1px;}
a.copyright		{ color: #444444; text-decoration: none;}
a.copyright:hover { color: #000000; text-decoration: underline;}

/* Form elements */
input,textarea, select {
	color : #000000;
	font: normal 11px Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	border-color : #000000;
}

/* The text input fields background colour */
input.post, textarea.post, select {
	background-color : #FFFFFF;
}

input { text-indent : 2px; }

/* The buttons used for bbCode styling in message post */
input.button {
	background-color : #EFEFEF;
	color : #000000;
	font-size: 11px; font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
}

/* The main submit button option */
input.mainoption {
	background-color : #FAFAFA;
	font-weight : bold;
}

/* None-bold submit button */
input.liteoption {
	background-color : #FAFAFA;
	font-weight : normal;
}

/* This is the line in the posting page which shows the rollover
  help line. This is actually a text box, but if set to be the same
  colour as the background no one will know ;)
*/
.helpline { background-color: #DEE3E7; border-style: none; }

/* Import the fancy styles for IE only (NS4.x doesn't use the @import function) */
@import url("https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/formIE.css");
-->
]] ></style>
  </head>

<script><![CDATA[ if (window.archive_analytics) { window.archive_analytics.values['server_name']="wwwb-app15.us.archive.org";}; ]] ></script><script type="text/javascript" src="https://web.archive.org/static/js/disclaim-element.js"/><script type="text/javascript" src="https://web.archive.org/static/js/graph-calc.js"/><script type="text/javascript" src="https://web.archive.org/static/jflot/jquery.min.js"/><script type="text/javascript"><![CDATA[
//<![CDATA[
var firstDate = 820454400000;
var lastDate = 1420070399999;
var wbPrefix = "/web/";
var wbCurrentUrl = "http:\/\/www.doom3world.org\/phpbb2\/viewtopic.php?p=97859";

var curYear = -1;
var curMonth = -1;
var yearCount = 18;
var firstYear = 1996;
var imgWidth = 475;
var yearImgWidth = 25;
var monthImgWidth = 2;
var trackerVal = "none";
var displayDay = "9";
var displayMonth = "May";
var displayYear = "2007";
var prettyMonths = ["Jan","Feb","Mar","Apr","May","Jun","Jul","Aug","Sep","Oct","Nov","Dec"];

function showTrackers(val) {
	if(val == trackerVal) {
		return;
	}
	if(val == "inline") {
		document.getElementById("displayYearEl").style.color = "#ec008c";
		document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").style.color = "#ec008c";
		document.getElementById("displayDayEl").style.color = "#ec008c";		
	} else {
		document.getElementById("displayYearEl").innerHTML = displayYear;
		document.getElementById("displayYearEl").style.color = "#ff0";
		document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").innerHTML = displayMonth;
		document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").style.color = "#ff0";
		document.getElementById("displayDayEl").innerHTML = displayDay;
		document.getElementById("displayDayEl").style.color = "#ff0";
	}
   document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackYearImg").style.display = val;
   document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackMonthImg").style.display = val;
   trackerVal = val;
}
function getElementX2(obj) {
	var thing = jQuery(obj);
	if((thing == undefined) 
			|| (typeof thing == "undefined") 
			|| (typeof thing.offset == "undefined")) {
		return getElementX(obj);
	}
	return Math.round(thing.offset().left);
}
function trackMouseMove(event,element) {

   var eventX = getEventX(event);
   var elementX = getElementX2(element);
   var xOff = eventX - elementX;
	if(xOff < 0) {
		xOff = 0;
	} else if(xOff > imgWidth) {
		xOff = imgWidth;
	}
   var monthOff = xOff % yearImgWidth;

   var year = Math.floor(xOff / yearImgWidth);
	var yearStart = year * yearImgWidth;
   var monthOfYear = Math.floor(monthOff / monthImgWidth);
   if(monthOfYear > 11) {
       monthOfYear = 11;
   }
   // 1 extra border pixel at the left edge of the year:
   var month = (year * 12) + monthOfYear;
   var day = 1;
	if(monthOff % 2 == 1) {
		day = 15;
	}
	var dateString = 
		zeroPad(year + firstYear) + 
		zeroPad(monthOfYear+1,2) +
		zeroPad(day,2) + "000000";

	var monthString = prettyMonths[monthOfYear];
	document.getElementById("displayYearEl").innerHTML = year + 1996;
	document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").innerHTML = monthString;
	// looks too jarring when it changes..
	//document.getElementById("displayDayEl").innerHTML = zeroPad(day,2);

	var url = wbPrefix + dateString + '/' +  wbCurrentUrl;
	document.getElementById('wm-graph-anchor').href = url;

   //document.getElementById("wmtbURL").value="evX("+eventX+") elX("+elementX+") xO("+xOff+") y("+year+") m("+month+") monthOff("+monthOff+") DS("+dateString+") Moy("+monthOfYear+") ms("+monthString+")";
   if(curYear != year) {
       var yrOff = year * yearImgWidth;
       document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackYearImg").style.left = yrOff + "px";
       curYear = year;
   }
   if(curMonth != month) {
       var mtOff = year + (month * monthImgWidth) + 1;
       document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackMonthImg").style.left = mtOff + "px";
       curMonth = month;
   }
}
//]]]] ><![CDATA[>

		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=95575&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019#95575"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Sun May 22, 2005 7:53 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=95575&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">Is there a way to attach a sound sapeaker to a md5's origin bone ? 
<br/><br/>
I have a scene where a f-16 jet is flying through the level (animated in 3dsmax and exported to md5) and I would like to add some jet engine sounds to it that move with the jet....... just binding the speaker to the model-entity's name didn't do the trick since the entity itself is not moving .........
<br/><br/>
Thanks for some suggestions in advance<br/>_________________<br/>I got six little friends and they all run faster than you <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_wink.gif" alt="Wink" border="0"/><br/><br/>
Check out my mods: 
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3.planet-multiplayer.de/5.56FMJ/opencoop/eCoop/" target="_blank" class="postlink">eCoop</a> and <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3.planet-multiplayer.de/5.56FMJ/" target="_blank" class="postlink">5.56mm Full Metal Jacket</a>...</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row1" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=97859#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>

		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=95581&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019#95581"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Sun May 22, 2005 8:18 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=95581&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">I'm a dummy with models, but you could probably create an invisible func_mover, bind the speaker to that, and move it to sync up with the anim.
<br/><br/>
There's probably a way to bind the speaker though, since there is a way to bind the flashlight to a zombie's hand.<br/>_________________<br/>Check out <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://cdoom.d3files.com/" target="_blank" class="postlink">Classic Doom 3!</a>
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.omegadrivers.net/" target="_blank" class="postlink">Support OmegaDrive</a></span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row2" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=97859#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>
		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap"><table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" height="18" width="18"><tr><td valign="middle" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/profile.php?mode=viewprofile&u=12138&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_profile.gif" alt="View user's profile" title="View user's profile" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/privmsg.php?mode=post&u=12138&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_pm.gif" alt="Send private message" title="Send private message" border="0"/></a> <a href="mailto:snoopjedi@comcast.net"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_email.gif" alt="Send e-mail" title="Send e-mail" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://home.comcast.net/~snoopjedi" target="_userwww"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_www.gif" alt="Visit poster's website" title="Visit poster's website" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/aim:goim?screenname=computergeek900&message=Hello+Are+you+there?"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_aim.gif" alt="AIM Address" title="AIM Address" border="0"/></a>  <script language="JavaScript" type="text/javascript"><![CDATA[<!--

	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row1"><span class="name"><a name="95587"/><b>BloodRayne</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">respawned 1350 times<br/><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/avatars/upload/157795361542bdb7076945d.gif" alt="" border="0"/><br/><br/>Joined: 13 Aug 2004<br/>Posts: 1483<br/>Location: Beyond the Veil</span><br/></td>
		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=95587&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019#95587"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Sun May 22, 2005 8:58 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=95587&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody"/><table width="90%" cellspacing="1" cellpadding="3" border="0" align="center"><tr><td><span class="genmed"><b>Oneofthe8devilz wrote:</b></span></td>	</tr><tr><td class="quote">Is there a way to attach a sound sapeaker to a md5's origin bone ? </td>	</tr></table><span class="postbody">
<br/><br/>
You don't need to, since it's an entity you can just call the sound from the animation def. An example:
<br/><br/></span><table width="90%" cellspacing="1" cellpadding="3" border="0" align="center"><tr><td><span class="genmed"><b>Code:</b></span></td>	</tr><tr><td class="code">
<br/>
model model_myf16 {
<br/>
 mesh models/md5/my_f16.md5mesh
<br/><br/>
 anim fly models/md5/my_f16_fly.md5anim {
<br/>
        frame 1 sound_body snd_fly
<br/>
 }
<br/></td>	</tr></table><span class="postbody">
<br/><br/>
snd_fly is then just a sounddecls you can define anywhere as soundshader.<br/>_________________<br/>Hexen Edge Of Chaos
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?t=17474" target="_blank" class="postlink">Download</a> the Ultimate Mod
<br/><br/>
Personal websites:
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://pixels.ontheweb.nl/" target="_blank" class="postlink">http://pixels.ontheweb.nl</a></span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row1" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=97859#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>
		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap"><table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" height="18" width="18"><tr><td valign="middle" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/profile.php?mode=viewprofile&u=3217&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_profile.gif" alt="View user's profile" title="View user's profile" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/privmsg.php?mode=post&u=3217&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_pm.gif" alt="Send private message" title="Send private message" border="0"/></a> <a href="mailto:b.dezwart@kpnplanet.nl"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_email.gif" alt="Send e-mail" title="Send e-mail" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://pixels.ontheweb.nl/" target="_userwww"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_www.gif" alt="Visit poster's website" title="Visit poster's website" border="0"/></a>   <script language="JavaScript" type="text/javascript"><![CDATA[<!--

	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row2"><span class="name"><a name="95592"/><b>Oneofthe8devilz</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">fired 300 rounds<br/><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/avatars/upload/152545107143b26a24a4793.jpg" alt="" border="0"/><br/><br/>Joined: 12 Dec 2003<br/>Posts: 336<br/>Location: Kassel / Germany</span><br/></td>
		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=95592&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019#95592"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Sun May 22, 2005 9:22 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=95592&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody"/><table width="90%" cellspacing="1" cellpadding="3" border="0" align="center"><tr><td><span class="genmed"><b>Quote:</b></span></td>	</tr><tr><td class="quote">You don't need to, since it's an entity you can just call the sound from the animation def. An example: 
<br/><br/>
Code: 
<br/><br/>
model model_myf16 { 
<br/>
   mesh   models/md5/my_f16.md5mesh 
<br/><br/>
   anim fly   models/md5/my_f16_fly.md5anim { 
<br/>
                frame 1   sound_body snd_fly 
<br/>
   } 
<br/><br/><br/><br/>
snd_fly is then just a sounddecls you can define anywhere as soundshader.
<br/></td>	</tr></table><span class="postbody">
<br/><br/><br/>
Actually I got it working by looking closer at the "cinematics.def" file a couple of hours ago..... I was just so amazed by the fact that I got it working that I forgot to post you guys ........
<br/><br/>
Still thanks for that quick response bloodrayne <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_wink.gif" alt="Wink" border="0"/>......
<br/><br/>
That's how I solved the problem:
<br/><br/><br/></span><table width="90%" cellspacing="1" cellpadding="3" border="0" align="center"><tr><td><span class="genmed"><b>Code:</b></span></td>	</tr><tr><td class="code">model f16_jet {
<br/>
 mesh  models/chris_md5/f16_jet.md5mesh 
<br/>
 anim f16flyby models/chris_md5/f16_jet.md5anim {
<br/>
 frame 1  sound f16_jet_engine
<br/>
 }
<br/>
}
<br/><br/>
entityDef f16_jet {  
<br/>
  "inherit" "func_animate"
<br/>
  "model"  "f16_jet"
<br/>
}</td>	</tr></table><span class="postbody">
<br/><br/>
"f16_jet_engine" is a looped soundshader that starts to play at frame 1 and gets played by the origin bone by default.... you can also define in the entity which bone shall play the sound.........
<br/><br/>
So once started it plays it infinitive times back......
<br/><br/>
I hope this might wind up useful for other ppl aswell......<br/>_________________<br/>I got six little friends and they all run faster than you <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_wink.gif" alt="Wink" border="0"/><br/><br/>
Check out my mods: 
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3.planet-multiplayer.de/5.56FMJ/opencoop/eCoop/" target="_blank" class="postlink">eCoop</a> and <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3.planet-multiplayer.de/5.56FMJ/" target="_blank" class="postlink">5.56mm Full Metal Jacket</a>...</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row2" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=97859#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>
		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap"><table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" height="18" width="18"><tr><td valign="middle" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/profile.php?mode=viewprofile&u=1165&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_profile.gif" alt="View user's profile" title="View user's profile" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/privmsg.php?mode=post&u=1165&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_pm.gif" alt="Send private message" title="Send private message" border="0"/></a>     <script language="JavaScript" type="text/javascript"><![CDATA[<!--

	</tr><tr><td class="spaceRow" colspan="2" height="1"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/spacer.gif" alt="" width="1" height="1"/></td>
	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row1"><span class="name"><a name="97853"/><b>bad marine ass</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">found a secret<br/><br/><br/>Joined: 26 Aug 2004<br/>Posts: 547<br/>Location: info_player_start</span><br/></td>
		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=97853&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019#97853"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Fri Jun 03, 2005 7:16 am<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=97853&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">Ok guys I have a bit of a problem with animation. My knowledge is almost at 0, but I understand in theory how it works
<br/><br/>
Take a look at this screenshot
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://img207.echo.cx/my.php?image=crossbow1jk.jpg" target="_blank" class="postlink"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://img207.echo.cx/img207/9454/crossbow1jk.th.jpg" border="0"/></a>
<br/><br/>
Now what I want to do is to make the trigger move. The tension of the rope is released and the rope is moved forward, and then the bolt will also move forward with lightning speed and push the bolt (which isnt present in the screenshot) out of the crossbow
<br/><br/>
I have 2 questions:
<br/><br/>
1) my crossbow is made up of 7-8 different layers of parts ie. trigger in one layer, handle in one layer etc, do I need to combine them?
<br/>
2) How do I actually get the crossbow to behave in the above-mentioned way? Any help will be appreciated. I've been reading the tutorials, and I've heard of the motion mixer plugin and stuff like that, but I'm very confused as to how I should get myself orientated and started with this</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row1" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=97859#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>
		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap"><table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" height="18" width="18"><tr><td valign="middle" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/profile.php?mode=viewprofile&u=4415&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_profile.gif" alt="View user's profile" title="View user's profile" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/privmsg.php?mode=post&u=4415&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_pm.gif" alt="Send private message" title="Send private message" border="0"/></a>     <script language="JavaScript" type="text/javascript"><![CDATA[<!--

		document.write(' ');

		document.write(']] ></script></td><td></td><td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><div style="position:relative"><div style="position:absolute"/><div style="position:absolute;left:3px;top:-1px"/></div>');

				//--><noscript/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="spaceRow" colspan="2" height="1"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/spacer.gif" alt="" width="1" height="1"/></td>
	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row2"><span class="name"><a name="97859"/><b>rich_is_bored</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">a gun & a nice word<br/><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/avatars/upload/78944047442bf8d370f59a.gif" alt="" border="0"/><br/><br/>Joined: 11 Jan 2003<br/>Posts: 7102<br/>Location: Orlando, FL</span><br/></td>
		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=97859&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019#97859"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Fri Jun 03, 2005 8:53 am<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=97859&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">Well if you have any intention of exporting that weapon to Doom 3 then you'd best forget all the special animation tools Lightwave affords you and stick to using bones because bone transformations are the only transformations that can be stored in a MD5anim.
<br/><br/>
Aside from that you'll probably need to merge all the layers aswell.<br/>_________________<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/" target="_blank" class="postlink"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/site/img/d3w.gif" border="0"/>  Staff</a>
<br/>
Learn something today? Why not write an article about it on <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.modwiki.net/wiki/Main_Page" target="_blank" class="postlink">modwiki.net</a>?</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row2" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=97859#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>
		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap"><table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" height="18" width="18"><tr><td valign="middle" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/profile.php?mode=viewprofile&u=517&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_profile.gif" alt="View user's profile" title="View user's profile" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/privmsg.php?mode=post&u=517&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_pm.gif" alt="Send private message" title="Send private message" border="0"/></a> <a href="mailto:RichardBartlett@cfl.rr.com"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_email.gif" alt="Send e-mail" title="Send e-mail" border="0"/></a>    <script language="JavaScript" type="text/javascript"><![CDATA[<!--

	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row1"><span class="name"><a name="97957"/><b>Brain Trepaning</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">Last man standing<br/><br/><br/>Joined: 09 Aug 2004<br/>Posts: 1226<br/>Location: Vancouver, Canada</span><br/></td>
		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=97957&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019#97957"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Fri Jun 03, 2005 11:05 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=97957&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">You don't need to animate with bones to use der_ton's general MD5 exporter, but that's for 3ds Max.<br/>_________________<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://trepaning.com/" target="_blank" class="postlink">Good Bye!</a></span><span class="gensmall"/></td>

	</tr><tr><td class="row1" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=97859#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>

	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row2"><span class="name"><a name="98011"/><b>bad marine ass</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">found a secret<br/><br/><br/>Joined: 26 Aug 2004<br/>Posts: 547<br/>Location: info_player_start</span><br/></td>
		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=98011&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019#98011"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Sat Jun 04, 2005 12:37 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=98011&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">I'll be using bones for the rope, but the other movements like the bolt (that little thingy holding the rope taut) and the recoil movement of the crossbow itself, do I have to use bones too?</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row2" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=97859#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>
		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap"><table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" height="18" width="18"><tr><td valign="middle" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/profile.php?mode=viewprofile&u=4415&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_profile.gif" alt="View user's profile" title="View user's profile" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/privmsg.php?mode=post&u=4415&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_pm.gif" alt="Send private message" title="Send private message" border="0"/></a>     <script language="JavaScript" type="text/javascript"><![CDATA[<!--

			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="spaceRow" colspan="2" height="1"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/spacer.gif" alt="" width="1" height="1"/></td>
	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row1"><span class="name"><a name="98016"/><b>der_ton</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">Camper<br/><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/avatars/upload/31467175940cee9f963bdc.jpg" alt="" border="0"/><br/><br/>Joined: 27 Jun 2003<br/>Posts: 2442<br/>Location: Munich, Germany</span><br/></td>
		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=98016&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019#98016"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Sat Jun 04, 2005 1:27 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=98016&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">I think it's best if you try out the process of getting an animated model from LW into D3 with an example, instead of putting lots of time into animating your model with the wrong methods, walking down a long road just to see it's a dead end.<br/>_________________<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/" target="_blank" class="postlink"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/site/img/d3w.gif" border="0"/> Staff</a>
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?t=5474" target="_blank" class="postlink">Modelviewer  |  3DSMax<->MD5  |  Blender<->MD5</a></span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row1" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=97859#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>
		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap"><table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" height="18" width="18"><tr><td valign="middle" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/profile.php?mode=viewprofile&u=831&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_profile.gif" alt="View user's profile" title="View user's profile" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/privmsg.php?mode=post&u=831&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_pm.gif" alt="Send private message" title="Send private message" border="0"/></a> <a href="mailto:tom-@gmx.de"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_email.gif" alt="Send e-mail" title="Send e-mail" border="0"/></a>    <script language="JavaScript" type="text/javascript"><![CDATA[<!--

		document.write(']] ></script></td><td></td><td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><div style="position:relative"><div style="position:absolute"/><div style="position:absolute;left:3px;top:-1px"/></div>');

	</tr><tr><td class="spaceRow" colspan="2" height="1"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/spacer.gif" alt="" width="1" height="1"/></td>
	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row2"><span class="name"><a name="98026"/><b>Fingernail</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">picked up 100 armour<br/><br/><br/>Joined: 19 Aug 2004<br/>Posts: 106<br/></span><br/></td>
		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=98026&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019#98026"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Sat Jun 04, 2005 2:20 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=98026&sid=76109f928cc9a0a36b8fe4cf80666019"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">Although we need animators (Dark Mod), we're probably not the MOST at need. We have a couple of people at least capable of animating, and we've got about three animations in on a couple of characters (walking, running, punching), but it's great to see the community recognising this "problem".
<br/><br/>
Depending on how things go, we may need your help, but with us it's a case of, we have a couple of people who CAN do animations, it's just that they also have a helluva lot of models to do and don't have the time to ONLY do animations, etc. etc. We're just about to go on a bit of an "advertising campaign" searching for animators, actually.</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>

post.date: Posted: Sun May 22, 2005 8:58 pm Post subject:
post.author: BloodRayne
post.body:
Oneofthe8devilz wrote:
Is there a way to attach a sound sapeaker to a md5's origin bone ?


You don't need to, since it's an entity you can just call the sound from the animation def. An example:

Code:

model model_myf16 {
   mesh   models/md5/my_f16.md5mesh

   anim fly   models/md5/my_f16_fly.md5anim {
                frame 1   sound_body snd_fly
   }


snd_fly is then just a sounddecls you can define anywhere as soundshader.
_________________
Hexen Edge Of Chaos
Download the Ultimate Mod

Personal websites:
http://pixels.ontheweb.nl

post.date: Posted: Sun May 22, 2005 9:22 pm Post subject:
post.author: Oneofthe8devilz
post.body:
Quote:
You don't need to, since it's an entity you can just call the sound from the animation def. An example:

Code:

model model_myf16 {
mesh models/md5/my_f16.md5mesh

anim fly models/md5/my_f16_fly.md5anim {
frame 1 sound_body snd_fly
}



snd_fly is then just a sounddecls you can define anywhere as soundshader.



Actually I got it working by looking closer at the "cinematics.def" file a couple of hours ago..... I was just so amazed by the fact that I got it working that I forgot to post you guys ........

Still thanks for that quick response bloodrayne ......

That's how I solved the problem:


Code:
model f16_jet {
   mesh      models/chris_md5/f16_jet.md5mesh   
   anim f16flyby   models/chris_md5/f16_jet.md5anim {
   frame 1      sound f16_jet_engine
   }
}

entityDef f16_jet {      
      "inherit"   "func_animate"
      "model"      "f16_jet"
}


"f16_jet_engine" is a looped soundshader that starts to play at frame 1 and gets played by the origin bone by default.... you can also define in the entity which bone shall play the sound.........

So once started it plays it infinitive times back......

I hope this might wind up useful for other ppl aswell......
_________________

eCoop and 5.56mm Full Metal Jacket...

post.date: Posted: Fri Jun 03, 2005 7:16 am Post subject:
post.author: bad marine ass
post.body:
Ok guys I have a bit of a problem with animation. My knowledge is almost at 0, but I understand in theory how it works

Take a look at this screenshot


Now what I want to do is to make the trigger move. The tension of the rope is released and the rope is moved forward, and then the bolt will also move forward with lightning speed and push the bolt (which isnt present in the screenshot) out of the crossbow

I have 2 questions:

1) my crossbow is made up of 7-8 different layers of parts ie. trigger in one layer, handle in one layer etc, do I need to combine them?
2) How do I actually get the crossbow to behave in the above-mentioned way? Any help will be appreciated. I've been reading the tutorials, and I've heard of the motion mixer plugin and stuff like that, but I'm very confused as to how I should get myself orientated and started with this

post.date: Posted: Fri Jun 03, 2005 8:53 am Post subject:
post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body:
Well if you have any intention of exporting that weapon to Doom 3 then you'd best forget all the special animation tools Lightwave affords you and stick to using bones because bone transformations are the only transformations that can be stored in a MD5anim.

Aside from that you'll probably need to merge all the layers aswell.
_________________
Staff

Depending on how things go, we may need your help, but with us it's a case of, we have a couple of people who CAN do animations, it's just that they also have a helluva lot of models to do and don't have the time to ONLY do animations, etc. etc. We're just about to go on a bit of an "advertising campaign" searching for animators, actually.

th.thSides,td.catSides,td.spaceRow	 { border-width: 0px 1px 0px 1px; }
th.thRight,td.catRight,td.row3Right	 { border-width: 0px 1px 0px 0px; }
th.thLeft,td.catLeft	  { border-width: 0px 0px 0px 1px; }
th.thBottom,td.catBottom  { border-width: 0px 1px 1px 1px; }
th.thTop	 { border-width: 1px 0px 0px 0px; }
th.thCornerL { border-width: 1px 0px 0px 1px; }
th.thCornerR { border-width: 1px 1px 0px 0px; }

/* The largest text used in the index page title and toptic title etc. */
.maintitle	{
	font-weight: bold; font-size: 22px; font-family: "Trebuchet MS",Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	text-decoration: none; line-height : 120%; color : #000000;
}

/* General text */
.gen { font-size : 12px; }
.genmed { font-size : 11px; }
.gensmall { font-size : 10px; }
.gen,.genmed,.gensmall { color : #000000; }
a.gen,a.genmed,a.gensmall { color: #006699; text-decoration: none; }
a.gen:hover,a.genmed:hover,a.gensmall:hover	{ color: #DD6900; text-decoration: underline; }

/* The register, login, search etc links at the top of the page */
.mainmenu		{ font-size : 11px; color : #000000 }
a.mainmenu		{ text-decoration: none; color : #006699;  }
a.mainmenu:hover{ text-decoration: underline; color : #DD6900; }

/* Forum category titles */
.cattitle		{ font-weight: bold; font-size: 12px ; letter-spacing: 1px; color : #006699}
a.cattitle		{ text-decoration: none; color : #006699; }
a.cattitle:hover{ text-decoration: underline; }

/* Forum title: Text and link to the forums used in: index.php */
.forumlink		{ font-weight: bold; font-size: 12px; color : #006699; }
a.forumlink 	{ text-decoration: none; color : #006699; }
a.forumlink:hover{ text-decoration: underline; color : #DD6900; }

/* Used for the navigation text, (Page 1,2,3 etc) and the navigation bar when in a forum */
.nav			{ font-weight: bold; font-size: 11px; color : #000000;}
a.nav			{ text-decoration: none; color : #006699; }
a.nav:hover		{ text-decoration: underline; }

/* titles for the topics: could specify viewed link colour too */
.topictitle,h1,h2	{ font-weight: bold; font-size: 11px; color : #000000; }
a.topictitle:link   { text-decoration: none; color : #006699; }
a.topictitle:visited { text-decoration: none; color : #5493B4; }
a.topictitle:hover	{ text-decoration: underline; color : #DD6900; }

/* Name of poster in viewmsg.php and viewtopic.php and other places */
.name			{ font-size : 11px; color : #000000;}

/* Location, number of posts, post date etc */
.postdetails		{ font-size : 10px; color : #000000; }

/* The content of the posts (body of text) */
.postbody { font-size : 12px; line-height: 18px}
a.postlink:link	{ text-decoration: none; color : #006699 }
a.postlink:visited { text-decoration: none; color : #5493B4; }
a.postlink:hover { text-decoration: underline; color : #DD6900}

/* Quote & Code blocks */
.code {
	font-family: Courier, 'Courier New', sans-serif; font-size: 11px; color: #006600;
	background-color: #FAFAFA; border: #D1D7DC; border-style: solid;
	border-left-width: 1px; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px
}

.quote {
	font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 11px; color: #444444; line-height: 125%;
	background-color: #FAFAFA; border: #D1D7DC; border-style: solid;
	border-left-width: 1px; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px
}

/* Copyright and bottom info */
.copyright		{ font-size: 10px; font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; color: #444444; letter-spacing: -1px;}
a.copyright		{ color: #444444; text-decoration: none;}
a.copyright:hover { color: #000000; text-decoration: underline;}

/* Form elements */
input,textarea, select {
	color : #000000;
	font: normal 11px Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	border-color : #000000;
}

/* The text input fields background colour */
input.post, textarea.post, select {
	background-color : #FFFFFF;
}

input { text-indent : 2px; }

/* The buttons used for bbCode styling in message post */
input.button {
	background-color : #EFEFEF;
	color : #000000;
	font-size: 11px; font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
}

/* The main submit button option */
input.mainoption {
	background-color : #FAFAFA;
	font-weight : bold;
}

/* None-bold submit button */
input.liteoption {
	background-color : #FAFAFA;
	font-weight : normal;
}

/* This is the line in the posting page which shows the rollover
  help line. This is actually a text box, but if set to be the same
  colour as the background no one will know ;)
*/
.helpline { background-color: #DEE3E7; border-style: none; }

/* Import the fancy styles for IE only (NS4.x doesn't use the @import function) */
@import url("https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/formIE.css");
-->
]] ></style>

var curMonth = -1;

var imgWidth = 475;
var yearImgWidth = 25;
var monthImgWidth = 2;

var displayDay = "9";
var displayMonth = "May";
var displayYear = "2007";
var prettyMonths = ["Jan","Feb","Mar","Apr","May","Jun","Jul","Aug","Sep","Oct","Nov","Dec"];

function showTrackers(val) {
	if(val == trackerVal) {
		return;
	}
	if(val == "inline") {
		document.getElementById("displayYearEl").style.color = "#ec008c";
		document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").style.color = "#ec008c";
		document.getElementById("displayDayEl").style.color = "#ec008c";		
	} else {
		document.getElementById("displayYearEl").innerHTML = displayYear;
		document.getElementById("displayYearEl").style.color = "#ff0";
		document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").innerHTML = displayMonth;
		document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").style.color = "#ff0";
		document.getElementById("displayDayEl").innerHTML = displayDay;
		document.getElementById("displayDayEl").style.color = "#ff0";
	}
   document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackYearImg").style.display = val;
   document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackMonthImg").style.display = val;
   trackerVal = val;
}
function getElementX2(obj) {
	var thing = jQuery(obj);
	if((thing == undefined) 
			|| (typeof thing == "undefined") 
			|| (typeof thing.offset == "undefined")) {
		return getElementX(obj);
	}
	return Math.round(thing.offset().left);
}
function trackMouseMove(event,element) {

   var eventX = getEventX(event);
   var elementX = getElementX2(element);
   var xOff = eventX - elementX;
	if(xOff < 0) {
		xOff = 0;
	} else if(xOff > imgWidth) {
		xOff = imgWidth;
	}
   var monthOff = xOff % yearImgWidth;

   var year = Math.floor(xOff / yearImgWidth);
	var yearStart = year * yearImgWidth;
   var monthOfYear = Math.floor(monthOff / monthImgWidth);
   if(monthOfYear > 11) {
       monthOfYear = 11;
   }
   // 1 extra border pixel at the left edge of the year:
   var month = (year * 12) + monthOfYear;
   var day = 1;
	if(monthOff % 2 == 1) {
		day = 15;
	}
	var dateString = 
		zeroPad(year + firstYear) + 
		zeroPad(monthOfYear+1,2) +
		zeroPad(day,2) + "000000";

	var monthString = prettyMonths[monthOfYear];
	document.getElementById("displayYearEl").innerHTML = year + 1996;
	document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").innerHTML = monthString;
	// looks too jarring when it changes..
	//document.getElementById("displayDayEl").innerHTML = zeroPad(day,2);

	var url = wbPrefix + dateString + '/' +  wbCurrentUrl;
	document.getElementById('wm-graph-anchor').href = url;

   //document.getElementById("wmtbURL").value="evX("+eventX+") elX("+elementX+") xO("+xOff+") y("+year+") m("+month+") monthOff("+monthOff+") DS("+dateString+") Moy("+monthOfYear+") ms("+monthString+")";
   if(curYear != year) {
       var yrOff = year * yearImgWidth;
       document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackYearImg").style.left = yrOff + "px";
       curYear = year;
   }
   if(curMonth != month) {
       var mtOff = year + (month * monthImgWidth) + 1;
       document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackMonthImg").style.left = mtOff + "px";
       curMonth = month;
   }
}
//]]]] ><![CDATA[>

		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=95575&sid=f64dac25618f7351b1ae654e1fb4f4cf#95575"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Sun May 22, 2005 7:53 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=95575&sid=f64dac25618f7351b1ae654e1fb4f4cf"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">Is there a way to attach a sound sapeaker to a md5's origin bone ? 
<br/><br/>
I have a scene where a f-16 jet is flying through the level (animated in 3dsmax and exported to md5) and I would like to add some jet engine sounds to it that move with the jet....... just binding the speaker to the model-entity's name didn't do the trick since the entity itself is not moving .........
<br/><br/>
Thanks for some suggestions in advance<br/>_________________<br/>I got six little friends and they all run faster than you <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_wink.gif" alt="Wink" border="0"/><br/><br/>
Check out my mods: 
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3.planet-multiplayer.de/5.56FMJ/opencoop/eCoop/" target="_blank" class="postlink">eCoop</a> and <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3.planet-multiplayer.de/5.56FMJ/" target="_blank" class="postlink">5.56mm Full Metal Jacket</a>...</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row1" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=97957#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>

		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=95581&sid=f64dac25618f7351b1ae654e1fb4f4cf#95581"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Sun May 22, 2005 8:18 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=95581&sid=f64dac25618f7351b1ae654e1fb4f4cf"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">I'm a dummy with models, but you could probably create an invisible func_mover, bind the speaker to that, and move it to sync up with the anim.
<br/><br/>
There's probably a way to bind the speaker though, since there is a way to bind the flashlight to a zombie's hand.<br/>_________________<br/>Check out <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://cdoom.d3files.com/" target="_blank" class="postlink">Classic Doom 3!</a>
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.omegadrivers.net/" target="_blank" class="postlink">Support OmegaDrive</a></span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>

			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="spaceRow" colspan="2" height="1"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/spacer.gif" alt="" width="1" height="1"/></td>
	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row1"><span class="name"><a name="95587"/><b>BloodRayne</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">respawned 1350 times<br/><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/avatars/upload/157795361542bdb7076945d.gif" alt="" border="0"/><br/><br/>Joined: 13 Aug 2004<br/>Posts: 1483<br/>Location: Beyond the Veil</span><br/></td>
		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=95587&sid=f64dac25618f7351b1ae654e1fb4f4cf#95587"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Sun May 22, 2005 8:58 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=95587&sid=f64dac25618f7351b1ae654e1fb4f4cf"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody"/><table width="90%" cellspacing="1" cellpadding="3" border="0" align="center"><tr><td><span class="genmed"><b>Oneofthe8devilz wrote:</b></span></td>	</tr><tr><td class="quote">Is there a way to attach a sound sapeaker to a md5's origin bone ? </td>	</tr></table><span class="postbody">
<br/><br/>
You don't need to, since it's an entity you can just call the sound from the animation def. An example:
<br/><br/></span><table width="90%" cellspacing="1" cellpadding="3" border="0" align="center"><tr><td><span class="genmed"><b>Code:</b></span></td>	</tr><tr><td class="code">
<br/>
model model_myf16 {
<br/>
 mesh models/md5/my_f16.md5mesh
<br/><br/>
 anim fly models/md5/my_f16_fly.md5anim {
<br/>
        frame 1 sound_body snd_fly
<br/>
 }
<br/></td>	</tr></table><span class="postbody">
<br/><br/>
snd_fly is then just a sounddecls you can define anywhere as soundshader.<br/>_________________<br/>Hexen Edge Of Chaos
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?t=17474" target="_blank" class="postlink">Download</a> the Ultimate Mod
<br/><br/>
Personal websites:
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://pixels.ontheweb.nl/" target="_blank" class="postlink">http://pixels.ontheweb.nl</a></span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row1" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=97957#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>
		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap"><table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" height="18" width="18"><tr><td valign="middle" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/profile.php?mode=viewprofile&u=3217&sid=f64dac25618f7351b1ae654e1fb4f4cf"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_profile.gif" alt="View user's profile" title="View user's profile" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/privmsg.php?mode=post&u=3217&sid=f64dac25618f7351b1ae654e1fb4f4cf"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_pm.gif" alt="Send private message" title="Send private message" border="0"/></a> <a href="mailto:b.dezwart@kpnplanet.nl"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_email.gif" alt="Send e-mail" title="Send e-mail" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://pixels.ontheweb.nl/" target="_userwww"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_www.gif" alt="Visit poster's website" title="Visit poster's website" border="0"/></a>   <script language="JavaScript" type="text/javascript"><![CDATA[<!--

	</tr><tr><td class="spaceRow" colspan="2" height="1"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/spacer.gif" alt="" width="1" height="1"/></td>
	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row2"><span class="name"><a name="95592"/><b>Oneofthe8devilz</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">fired 300 rounds<br/><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/avatars/upload/152545107143b26a24a4793.jpg" alt="" border="0"/><br/><br/>Joined: 12 Dec 2003<br/>Posts: 336<br/>Location: Kassel / Germany</span><br/></td>
		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=95592&sid=f64dac25618f7351b1ae654e1fb4f4cf#95592"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Sun May 22, 2005 9:22 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=95592&sid=f64dac25618f7351b1ae654e1fb4f4cf"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody"/><table width="90%" cellspacing="1" cellpadding="3" border="0" align="center"><tr><td><span class="genmed"><b>Quote:</b></span></td>	</tr><tr><td class="quote">You don't need to, since it's an entity you can just call the sound from the animation def. An example: 
<br/><br/>
Code: 
<br/><br/>
model model_myf16 { 
<br/>
   mesh   models/md5/my_f16.md5mesh 
<br/><br/>
   anim fly   models/md5/my_f16_fly.md5anim { 
<br/>
                frame 1   sound_body snd_fly 
<br/>
   } 
<br/><br/><br/><br/>
snd_fly is then just a sounddecls you can define anywhere as soundshader.
<br/></td>	</tr></table><span class="postbody">
<br/><br/><br/>
Actually I got it working by looking closer at the "cinematics.def" file a couple of hours ago..... I was just so amazed by the fact that I got it working that I forgot to post you guys ........
<br/><br/>
Still thanks for that quick response bloodrayne <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_wink.gif" alt="Wink" border="0"/>......
<br/><br/>
That's how I solved the problem:
<br/><br/><br/></span><table width="90%" cellspacing="1" cellpadding="3" border="0" align="center"><tr><td><span class="genmed"><b>Code:</b></span></td>	</tr><tr><td class="code">model f16_jet {
<br/>
 mesh  models/chris_md5/f16_jet.md5mesh 
<br/>
 anim f16flyby models/chris_md5/f16_jet.md5anim {
<br/>
 frame 1  sound f16_jet_engine
<br/>
 }
<br/>
}
<br/><br/>
entityDef f16_jet {  
<br/>
  "inherit" "func_animate"
<br/>
  "model"  "f16_jet"
<br/>
}</td>	</tr></table><span class="postbody">
<br/><br/>
"f16_jet_engine" is a looped soundshader that starts to play at frame 1 and gets played by the origin bone by default.... you can also define in the entity which bone shall play the sound.........
<br/><br/>
So once started it plays it infinitive times back......
<br/><br/>
I hope this might wind up useful for other ppl aswell......<br/>_________________<br/>I got six little friends and they all run faster than you <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_wink.gif" alt="Wink" border="0"/><br/><br/>
Check out my mods: 
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3.planet-multiplayer.de/5.56FMJ/opencoop/eCoop/" target="_blank" class="postlink">eCoop</a> and <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3.planet-multiplayer.de/5.56FMJ/" target="_blank" class="postlink">5.56mm Full Metal Jacket</a>...</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row2" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=97957#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>
