	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row1"><span class="name"><a name="97853"/><b>bad marine ass</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">found a secret<br/><br/><br/>Joined: 26 Aug 2004<br/>Posts: 547<br/>Location: info_player_start</span><br/></td>
		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=97853&sid=f64dac25618f7351b1ae654e1fb4f4cf#97853"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Fri Jun 03, 2005 7:16 am<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=97853&sid=f64dac25618f7351b1ae654e1fb4f4cf"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">Ok guys I have a bit of a problem with animation. My knowledge is almost at 0, but I understand in theory how it works
<br/><br/>
Take a look at this screenshot
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://img207.echo.cx/my.php?image=crossbow1jk.jpg" target="_blank" class="postlink"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://img207.echo.cx/img207/9454/crossbow1jk.th.jpg" border="0"/></a>
<br/><br/>
Now what I want to do is to make the trigger move. The tension of the rope is released and the rope is moved forward, and then the bolt will also move forward with lightning speed and push the bolt (which isnt present in the screenshot) out of the crossbow
<br/><br/>
I have 2 questions:
<br/><br/>
1) my crossbow is made up of 7-8 different layers of parts ie. trigger in one layer, handle in one layer etc, do I need to combine them?
<br/>
2) How do I actually get the crossbow to behave in the above-mentioned way? Any help will be appreciated. I've been reading the tutorials, and I've heard of the motion mixer plugin and stuff like that, but I'm very confused as to how I should get myself orientated and started with this</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row1" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=97957#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>
		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap"><table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" height="18" width="18"><tr><td valign="middle" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/profile.php?mode=viewprofile&u=4415&sid=f64dac25618f7351b1ae654e1fb4f4cf"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_profile.gif" alt="View user's profile" title="View user's profile" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/privmsg.php?mode=post&u=4415&sid=f64dac25618f7351b1ae654e1fb4f4cf"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_pm.gif" alt="Send private message" title="Send private message" border="0"/></a>     <script language="JavaScript" type="text/javascript"><![CDATA[<!--

	</tr><tr><td class="spaceRow" colspan="2" height="1"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/spacer.gif" alt="" width="1" height="1"/></td>
	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row2"><span class="name"><a name="97859"/><b>rich_is_bored</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">a gun & a nice word<br/><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/avatars/upload/78944047442bf8d370f59a.gif" alt="" border="0"/><br/><br/>Joined: 11 Jan 2003<br/>Posts: 7106<br/>Location: Orlando, FL</span><br/></td>
		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=97859&sid=f64dac25618f7351b1ae654e1fb4f4cf#97859"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Fri Jun 03, 2005 8:53 am<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=97859&sid=f64dac25618f7351b1ae654e1fb4f4cf"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">Well if you have any intention of exporting that weapon to Doom 3 then you'd best forget all the special animation tools Lightwave affords you and stick to using bones because bone transformations are the only transformations that can be stored in a MD5anim.
<br/><br/>
Aside from that you'll probably need to merge all the layers aswell.<br/>_________________<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/" target="_blank" class="postlink"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/site/img/d3w.gif" border="0"/>  Staff</a>
<br/>
Learn something today? Why not write an article about it on <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.modwiki.net/wiki/Main_Page" target="_blank" class="postlink">modwiki.net</a>?</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row2" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=97957#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>
		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap"><table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" height="18" width="18"><tr><td valign="middle" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/profile.php?mode=viewprofile&u=517&sid=f64dac25618f7351b1ae654e1fb4f4cf"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_profile.gif" alt="View user's profile" title="View user's profile" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/privmsg.php?mode=post&u=517&sid=f64dac25618f7351b1ae654e1fb4f4cf"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_pm.gif" alt="Send private message" title="Send private message" border="0"/></a> <a href="mailto:RichardBartlett@cfl.rr.com"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_email.gif" alt="Send e-mail" title="Send e-mail" border="0"/></a>    <script language="JavaScript" type="text/javascript"><![CDATA[<!--

	</tr><tr><td class="spaceRow" colspan="2" height="1"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/spacer.gif" alt="" width="1" height="1"/></td>
	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row1"><span class="name"><a name="97957"/><b>Brain Trepaning</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">Last man standing<br/><br/><br/>Joined: 09 Aug 2004<br/>Posts: 1226<br/>Location: Vancouver, Canada</span><br/></td>
		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=97957&sid=f64dac25618f7351b1ae654e1fb4f4cf#97957"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Fri Jun 03, 2005 11:05 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=97957&sid=f64dac25618f7351b1ae654e1fb4f4cf"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">You don't need to animate with bones to use der_ton's general MD5 exporter, but that's for 3ds Max.<br/>_________________<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://trepaning.com/" target="_blank" class="postlink">Good Bye!</a></span><span class="gensmall"/></td>

post.body:

Ps: Blender it's the only free 3d app with md5 scripts that I can remember.. But it's the only 3D app that scares the hell out of me when I launch it and the layout pops up in front of me..ug

There's also Gmax, which is free, based on 3d studio max and has an md5 exporter.

post.body:

It' not the syntax things that makes me worried, it's the mathematical aspect.. I really can barely do 5+5 = 12.. Ops, 10, I mean, 10...

post.author: Oneofthe8devilz
post.body:
Is there a way to attach a sound sapeaker to a md5's origin bone ?

I have a scene where a f-16 jet is flying through the level (animated in 3dsmax and exported to md5) and I would like to add some jet engine sounds to it that move with the jet....... just binding the speaker to the model-entity's name didn't do the trick since the entity itself is not moving .........

Thanks for some suggestions in advance

post.author: SnoopJeDi
post.body:
I'm a dummy with models, but you could probably create an invisible func_mover, bind the speaker to that, and move it to sync up with the anim.

There's probably a way to bind the speaker though, since there is a way to bind the flashlight to a zombie's hand.

post.author: BloodRayne
post.body:
Oneofthe8devilz wrote:
Is there a way to attach a sound sapeaker to a md5's origin bone ?


You don't need to, since it's an entity you can just call the sound from the animation def. An example:

Code:
model model_myf16 {
   mesh   models/md5/my_f16.md5mesh

   anim fly   models/md5/my_f16_fly.md5anim {
                frame 1   sound_body snd_fly
   }


snd_fly is then just a sounddecls you can define anywhere as soundshader.

post.author: Oneofthe8devilz
post.body:
Quote:
You don't need to, since it's an entity you can just call the sound from the animation def. An example:

Code:

model model_myf16 {
mesh models/md5/my_f16.md5mesh

anim fly models/md5/my_f16_fly.md5anim {
frame 1 sound_body snd_fly
}



snd_fly is then just a sounddecls you can define anywhere as soundshader.



Actually I got it working by looking closer at the "cinematics.def" file a couple of hours ago..... I was just so amazed by the fact that I got it working that I forgot to post you guys ........

Still thanks for that quick response bloodrayne ......

That's how I solved the problem:


Code:
model f16_jet {
   mesh      models/chris_md5/f16_jet.md5mesh   
   anim f16flyby   models/chris_md5/f16_jet.md5anim {
   frame 1      sound f16_jet_engine
   }
}

entityDef f16_jet {      
      "inherit"   "func_animate"
      "model"      "f16_jet"
}


"f16_jet_engine" is a looped soundshader that starts to play at frame 1 and gets played by the origin bone by default.... you can also define in the entity which bone shall play the sound.........

So once started it plays it infinitive times back......

I hope this might wind up useful for other ppl aswell......

post.author: bad marine ass
post.body:
Ok guys I have a bit of a problem with animation. My knowledge is almost at 0, but I understand in theory how it works

Take a look at this screenshot


Now what I want to do is to make the trigger move. The tension of the rope is released and the rope is moved forward, and then the bolt will also move forward with lightning speed and push the bolt (which isnt present in the screenshot) out of the crossbow

I have 2 questions:

1) my crossbow is made up of 7-8 different layers of parts ie. trigger in one layer, handle in one layer etc, do I need to combine them?
2) How do I actually get the crossbow to behave in the above-mentioned way? Any help will be appreciated. I've been reading the tutorials, and I've heard of the motion mixer plugin and stuff like that, but I'm very confused as to how I should get myself orientated and started with this

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body:
Well if you have any intention of exporting that weapon to Doom 3 then you'd best forget all the special animation tools Lightwave affords you and stick to using bones because bone transformations are the only transformations that can be stored in a MD5anim.

Aside from that you'll probably need to merge all the layers aswell.

post.author: Brain Trepaning
post.body: You don't need to animate with bones to use der_ton's general MD5 exporter, but that's for 3ds Max.

post.author: bad marine ass
post.body: I'll be using bones for the rope, but the other movements like the bolt (that little thingy holding the rope taut) and the recoil movement of the crossbow itself, do I have to use bones too?

post.author: der_ton
post.body: I think it's best if you try out the process of getting an animated model from LW into D3 with an example, instead of putting lots of time into animating your model with the wrong methods, walking down a long road just to see it's a dead end.

post.author: Fingernail
post.body:
Although we need animators (Dark Mod), we're probably not the MOST at need. We have a couple of people at least capable of animating, and we've got about three animations in on a couple of characters (walking, running, punching), but it's great to see the community recognising this "problem".

Depending on how things go, we may need your help, but with us it's a case of, we have a couple of people who CAN do animations, it's just that they also have a helluva lot of models to do and don't have the time to ONLY do animations, etc. etc. We're just about to go on a bit of an "advertising campaign" searching for animators, actually.

post.author: bad marine ass
post.body: Hmm it seems that the animations don't work the way I thought they should work. I thought it was something like Flash, whereby the polygons moved frame by frame. How exactly do the bones work? I'm halfway thru an animation tutorial, but I still don't quite get it

post.author: doomkid3000
post.body: you want to setup your bone skeleton with IK's in whatever program your using, so that when you animate your charactor its easy to manipulate the movements, without having to animate each bone making life alot easier

post.author: bad marine ass
post.body: So basically the weapons would work exactly like the characters do?

post.author: doomkid3000
post.body: i dont think so, unless you have some crazy weapon design that has a crazy type of animation, then YES

post.author: bad marine ass
post.body: which means that maya is the only way to animate weapons?

post.author: obihb
post.body:
You can animate your weapon in whatever program you can end up getting it into Doom3. I know of Maya and Max being able to do this. If Lightwave can do it then animate in that. The main thing to know is that anything you want to have animation on needs to be animated with bones. Nothing can be animated inside Doom3 with the old Quake3 method of blend verts.

So if you wanted to have the crossbow shoot an arrow, the string needs to be animated with bones, so does the arrow and the hand pulling the trigger and whatever else.

Within Max, the way der_ton's exporter work everything has to be a single mesh. You can't have the arrow a seperate mesh and soforth. Then it just has to be skinned and weighted on the bones you provide to animate each part. The exporter also allow you to use whatever tool is to your disposal like IK or constraints or directly animating it. All this is also possible from within Maya accept for the export to be a longer process and I don't think you have to have a single mesh. I'm sorry I have no experience with Lightwave.

post.author: bad marine ass
post.body:
Brian mentioned this in his reply to my query

Quote:
For the first question, it doesn't really matter a whole lot which
method you use to animate as long as the exported file contains only
bones.


Which means that the only way, the one and only way to animate, is through bones?

post.author: obihb
post.body:
Yes. It has to be bones.

Some confusion might come into some of the posts from Brian in some threads where he talks about der_ton's exporter being able to generate bones for you based on vertex movement. As far as I know it was an experimental exporter made by der_ton to make it possible for easier facial animation. It's not very "game" friendly though because it generates a bone per vertex which ends up being way too much.

The bottom line is that bones is the one and only method to animate in Doom3. Of course the scripted animation is possible on "solid" objects with simple translation and rotation that can be done, no "vertex level" animation like for characters.

post.date: Posted: Sun May 22, 2005 8:58 pm Post subject:
post.author: BloodRayne
post.body:
Oneofthe8devilz wrote:
Is there a way to attach a sound sapeaker to a md5's origin bone ?


You don't need to, since it's an entity you can just call the sound from the animation def. An example:

Code:

model model_myf16 {
   mesh   models/md5/my_f16.md5mesh

   anim fly   models/md5/my_f16_fly.md5anim {
                frame 1   sound_body snd_fly
   }


snd_fly is then just a sounddecls you can define anywhere as soundshader.
_________________
Hexen Edge Of Chaos

http://pixels.ontheweb.nl

post.date: Posted: Sun May 22, 2005 9:22 pm Post subject:
post.author: Oneofthe8devilz
post.body:
Quote:
You don't need to, since it's an entity you can just call the sound from the animation def. An example:

Code:

model model_myf16 {
mesh models/md5/my_f16.md5mesh

anim fly models/md5/my_f16_fly.md5anim {
frame 1 sound_body snd_fly
}



snd_fly is then just a sounddecls you can define anywhere as soundshader.



Actually I got it working by looking closer at the "cinematics.def" file a couple of hours ago..... I was just so amazed by the fact that I got it working that I forgot to post you guys ........

Still thanks for that quick response bloodrayne ......

That's how I solved the problem:


Code:
model f16_jet {
   mesh      models/chris_md5/f16_jet.md5mesh   
   anim f16flyby   models/chris_md5/f16_jet.md5anim {
   frame 1      sound f16_jet_engine
   }
}

entityDef f16_jet {      
      "inherit"   "func_animate"
      "model"      "f16_jet"
}


"f16_jet_engine" is a looped soundshader that starts to play at frame 1 and gets played by the origin bone by default.... you can also define in the entity which bone shall play the sound.........

So once started it plays it infinitive times back......

I hope this might wind up useful for other ppl aswell......
_________________

post.date: Posted: Fri Jun 03, 2005 7:16 am Post subject:
post.author: bad marine ass
post.body:
Ok guys I have a bit of a problem with animation. My knowledge is almost at 0, but I understand in theory how it works

Take a look at this screenshot


Now what I want to do is to make the trigger move. The tension of the rope is released and the rope is moved forward, and then the bolt will also move forward with lightning speed and push the bolt (which isnt present in the screenshot) out of the crossbow

I have 2 questions:

1) my crossbow is made up of 7-8 different layers of parts ie. trigger in one layer, handle in one layer etc, do I need to combine them?
2) How do I actually get the crossbow to behave in the above-mentioned way? Any help will be appreciated. I've been reading the tutorials, and I've heard of the motion mixer plugin and stuff like that, but I'm very confused as to how I should get myself orientated and started with this

post.date: Posted: Fri Jun 03, 2005 8:53 am Post subject:
post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body:
Well if you have any intention of exporting that weapon to Doom 3 then you'd best forget all the special animation tools Lightwave affords you and stick to using bones because bone transformations are the only transformations that can be stored in a MD5anim.

Aside from that you'll probably need to merge all the layers aswell.
_________________
Staff

post.date: Posted: Sat Jun 04, 2005 2:20 pm Post subject:
post.author: Fingernail
post.body:
Although we need animators (Dark Mod), we're probably not the MOST at need. We have a couple of people at least capable of animating, and we've got about three animations in on a couple of characters (walking, running, punching), but it's great to see the community recognising this "problem".

Depending on how things go, we may need your help, but with us it's a case of, we have a couple of people who CAN do animations, it's just that they also have a helluva lot of models to do and don't have the time to ONLY do animations, etc. etc. We're just about to go on a bit of an "advertising campaign" searching for animators, actually.

//<![CDATA[
var firstDate = 820454400000;
var lastDate = 1420070399999;
var wbPrefix = "/web/";
var wbCurrentUrl = "http:\/\/doom3world.org\/phpbb2\/viewtopic.php?p=98026";

var curYear = -1;
var curMonth = -1;
var yearCount = 18;
var firstYear = 1996;
var imgWidth = 475;
var yearImgWidth = 25;
var monthImgWidth = 2;
var trackerVal = "none";
var displayDay = "9";
var displayMonth = "May";
var displayYear = "2007";
var prettyMonths = ["Jan","Feb","Mar","Apr","May","Jun","Jul","Aug","Sep","Oct","Nov","Dec"];

function showTrackers(val) {
	if(val == trackerVal) {
		return;
	}
	if(val == "inline") {
		document.getElementById("displayYearEl").style.color = "#ec008c";
		document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").style.color = "#ec008c";
		document.getElementById("displayDayEl").style.color = "#ec008c";		
	} else {
		document.getElementById("displayYearEl").innerHTML = displayYear;
		document.getElementById("displayYearEl").style.color = "#ff0";
		document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").innerHTML = displayMonth;
		document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").style.color = "#ff0";
		document.getElementById("displayDayEl").innerHTML = displayDay;
		document.getElementById("displayDayEl").style.color = "#ff0";
	}
   document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackYearImg").style.display = val;
   document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackMonthImg").style.display = val;
   trackerVal = val;
}
function getElementX2(obj) {
	var thing = jQuery(obj);
	if((thing == undefined) 
			|| (typeof thing == "undefined") 
			|| (typeof thing.offset == "undefined")) {
		return getElementX(obj);
	}
	return Math.round(thing.offset().left);
}
function trackMouseMove(event,element) {

   var eventX = getEventX(event);
   var elementX = getElementX2(element);
   var xOff = eventX - elementX;
	if(xOff < 0) {
		xOff = 0;
	} else if(xOff > imgWidth) {
		xOff = imgWidth;
	}
   var monthOff = xOff % yearImgWidth;

   var year = Math.floor(xOff / yearImgWidth);
	var yearStart = year * yearImgWidth;
   var monthOfYear = Math.floor(monthOff / monthImgWidth);
   if(monthOfYear > 11) {
       monthOfYear = 11;
   }
   // 1 extra border pixel at the left edge of the year:
   var month = (year * 12) + monthOfYear;
   var day = 1;
	if(monthOff % 2 == 1) {
		day = 15;
	}
	var dateString = 
		zeroPad(year + firstYear) + 
		zeroPad(monthOfYear+1,2) +
		zeroPad(day,2) + "000000";

	var monthString = prettyMonths[monthOfYear];
	document.getElementById("displayYearEl").innerHTML = year + 1996;
	document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").innerHTML = monthString;
	// looks too jarring when it changes..
	//document.getElementById("displayDayEl").innerHTML = zeroPad(day,2);

	var url = wbPrefix + dateString + '/' +  wbCurrentUrl;
	document.getElementById('wm-graph-anchor').href = url;

   //document.getElementById("wmtbURL").value="evX("+eventX+") elX("+elementX+") xO("+xOff+") y("+year+") m("+month+") monthOff("+monthOff+") DS("+dateString+") Moy("+monthOfYear+") ms("+monthString+")";
   if(curYear != year) {
       var yrOff = year * yearImgWidth;
       document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackYearImg").style.left = yrOff + "px";
       curYear = year;
   }
   if(curMonth != month) {
       var mtOff = year + (month * monthImgWidth) + 1;
       document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackMonthImg").style.left = mtOff + "px";
       curMonth = month;
   }
}
//]]]] ><![CDATA[>

<br/>
There's also Gmax, which is free, based on 3d studio max and has an md5 exporter.<br/>_________________<br/>Hexen Edge Of Chaos

		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=93814&sid=8ff47b9f09da7fd9c5fead755dad38df#93814"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Thu May 12, 2005 11:10 am<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=93814&sid=8ff47b9f09da7fd9c5fead755dad38df"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">Great, good to know.. Actually, what is the workflow to create a Lightwave script, or a general converter? Maybe Rich can answer that to me..
<br/><br/>
It' not the syntax things that makes me worried, it's the mathematical aspect.. I really can barely do 5+5 = 12.. Ops, 10, I mean, 10... <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_wink.gif" alt="Wink" border="0"/><br/>_________________<br/>theRev is coming...</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>

		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=95575&sid=8ff47b9f09da7fd9c5fead755dad38df#95575"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Sun May 22, 2005 7:53 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=95575&sid=8ff47b9f09da7fd9c5fead755dad38df"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">Is there a way to attach a sound sapeaker to a md5's origin bone ? 
<br/><br/>
I have a scene where a f-16 jet is flying through the level (animated in 3dsmax and exported to md5) and I would like to add some jet engine sounds to it that move with the jet....... just binding the speaker to the model-entity's name didn't do the trick since the entity itself is not moving .........
<br/><br/>
Thanks for some suggestions in advance<br/>_________________<br/>I got six little friends and they all run faster than you <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_wink.gif" alt="Wink" border="0"/><br/><br/>
Check out my mods: 
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3.planet-multiplayer.de/5.56FMJ/opencoop/eCoop/" target="_blank" class="postlink">eCoop</a> and <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3.planet-multiplayer.de/5.56FMJ/" target="_blank" class="postlink">5.56mm Full Metal Jacket</a>...</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row1" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=98026#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>

	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row2"><span class="name"><a name="95581"/><b>SnoopJeDi</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">Captured the Flag<br/><br/><br/>Joined: 06 Jan 2005<br/>Posts: 1860<br/>Location: 127.0.0.1</span><br/></td>
		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=95581&sid=8ff47b9f09da7fd9c5fead755dad38df#95581"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Sun May 22, 2005 8:18 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=95581&sid=8ff47b9f09da7fd9c5fead755dad38df"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">I'm a dummy with models, but you could probably create an invisible func_mover, bind the speaker to that, and move it to sync up with the anim.
<br/><br/>
There's probably a way to bind the speaker though, since there is a way to bind the flashlight to a zombie's hand.<br/>_________________<br/>Check out <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://cdoom.d3files.com/" target="_blank" class="postlink">Classic Doom 3!</a>
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.omegadrivers.net/" target="_blank" class="postlink">Support OmegaDrive</a></span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row2" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=98026#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>

	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row1"><span class="name"><a name="95587"/><b>BloodRayne</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">True believer<br/><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/avatars/upload/157795361542bdb7076945d.gif" alt="" border="0"/><br/><br/>Joined: 13 Aug 2004<br/>Posts: 1501<br/>Location: Beyond the Veil</span><br/></td>
		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=95587&sid=8ff47b9f09da7fd9c5fead755dad38df#95587"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Sun May 22, 2005 8:58 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=95587&sid=8ff47b9f09da7fd9c5fead755dad38df"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody"/><table width="90%" cellspacing="1" cellpadding="3" border="0" align="center"><tr><td><span class="genmed"><b>Oneofthe8devilz wrote:</b></span></td>	</tr><tr><td class="quote">Is there a way to attach a sound sapeaker to a md5's origin bone ? </td>	</tr></table><span class="postbody">
<br/><br/>
You don't need to, since it's an entity you can just call the sound from the animation def. An example:
<br/><br/></span><table width="90%" cellspacing="1" cellpadding="3" border="0" align="center"><tr><td><span class="genmed"><b>Code:</b></span></td>	</tr><tr><td class="code">
<br/>
model model_myf16 {
<br/>
 mesh models/md5/my_f16.md5mesh
<br/><br/>
 anim fly models/md5/my_f16_fly.md5anim {
<br/>
        frame 1 sound_body snd_fly
<br/>
 }
<br/></td>	</tr></table><span class="postbody">
<br/><br/>
snd_fly is then just a sounddecls you can define anywhere as soundshader.<br/>_________________<br/>Hexen Edge Of Chaos
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?t=17474" target="_blank" class="postlink">Download</a> the Ultimate Mod
<br/><br/>
Personal websites:
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://pixels.ontheweb.nl/" target="_blank" class="postlink">http://pixels.ontheweb.nl</a></span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row1" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=98026#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>

	</tr><tr><td class="spaceRow" colspan="2" height="1"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/spacer.gif" alt="" width="1" height="1"/></td>
	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row2"><span class="name"><a name="95592"/><b>Oneofthe8devilz</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">fired 300 rounds<br/><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/avatars/upload/152545107143b26a24a4793.jpg" alt="" border="0"/><br/><br/>Joined: 12 Dec 2003<br/>Posts: 337<br/>Location: Kassel / Germany</span><br/></td>
		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=95592&sid=8ff47b9f09da7fd9c5fead755dad38df#95592"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Sun May 22, 2005 9:22 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=95592&sid=8ff47b9f09da7fd9c5fead755dad38df"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody"/><table width="90%" cellspacing="1" cellpadding="3" border="0" align="center"><tr><td><span class="genmed"><b>Quote:</b></span></td>	</tr><tr><td class="quote">You don't need to, since it's an entity you can just call the sound from the animation def. An example: 
<br/><br/>
Code: 
<br/><br/>
model model_myf16 { 
<br/>
   mesh   models/md5/my_f16.md5mesh 
<br/><br/>
   anim fly   models/md5/my_f16_fly.md5anim { 
<br/>
                frame 1   sound_body snd_fly 
<br/>
   } 
<br/><br/><br/><br/>
snd_fly is then just a sounddecls you can define anywhere as soundshader.
<br/></td>	</tr></table><span class="postbody">
<br/><br/><br/>
Actually I got it working by looking closer at the "cinematics.def" file a couple of hours ago..... I was just so amazed by the fact that I got it working that I forgot to post you guys ........
<br/><br/>
Still thanks for that quick response bloodrayne <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_wink.gif" alt="Wink" border="0"/>......
<br/><br/>
That's how I solved the problem:
<br/><br/><br/></span><table width="90%" cellspacing="1" cellpadding="3" border="0" align="center"><tr><td><span class="genmed"><b>Code:</b></span></td>	</tr><tr><td class="code">model f16_jet {
<br/>
 mesh  models/chris_md5/f16_jet.md5mesh 
<br/>
 anim f16flyby models/chris_md5/f16_jet.md5anim {
<br/>
 frame 1  sound f16_jet_engine
<br/>
 }
<br/>
}
<br/><br/>
entityDef f16_jet {  
<br/>
  "inherit" "func_animate"
<br/>
  "model"  "f16_jet"
<br/>
}</td>	</tr></table><span class="postbody">
<br/><br/>
"f16_jet_engine" is a looped soundshader that starts to play at frame 1 and gets played by the origin bone by default.... you can also define in the entity which bone shall play the sound.........
<br/><br/>
So once started it plays it infinitive times back......
<br/><br/>
I hope this might wind up useful for other ppl aswell......<br/>_________________<br/>I got six little friends and they all run faster than you <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_wink.gif" alt="Wink" border="0"/><br/><br/>
Check out my mods: 
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3.planet-multiplayer.de/5.56FMJ/opencoop/eCoop/" target="_blank" class="postlink">eCoop</a> and <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3.planet-multiplayer.de/5.56FMJ/" target="_blank" class="postlink">5.56mm Full Metal Jacket</a>...</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row2" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=98026#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>

	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row1"><span class="name"><a name="97853"/><b>bad marine ass</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">found a secret<br/><br/><br/>Joined: 26 Aug 2004<br/>Posts: 547<br/>Location: info_player_start</span><br/></td>
		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=97853&sid=8ff47b9f09da7fd9c5fead755dad38df#97853"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Fri Jun 03, 2005 7:16 am<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=97853&sid=8ff47b9f09da7fd9c5fead755dad38df"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">Ok guys I have a bit of a problem with animation. My knowledge is almost at 0, but I understand in theory how it works
<br/><br/>
Take a look at this screenshot
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://img207.echo.cx/my.php?image=crossbow1jk.jpg" target="_blank" class="postlink"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://img207.echo.cx/img207/9454/crossbow1jk.th.jpg" border="0"/></a>
<br/><br/>
Now what I want to do is to make the trigger move. The tension of the rope is released and the rope is moved forward, and then the bolt will also move forward with lightning speed and push the bolt (which isnt present in the screenshot) out of the crossbow
<br/><br/>
I have 2 questions:
<br/><br/>
1) my crossbow is made up of 7-8 different layers of parts ie. trigger in one layer, handle in one layer etc, do I need to combine them?
<br/>
2) How do I actually get the crossbow to behave in the above-mentioned way? Any help will be appreciated. I've been reading the tutorials, and I've heard of the motion mixer plugin and stuff like that, but I'm very confused as to how I should get myself orientated and started with this</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row1" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=98026#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>
		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap"><table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" height="18" width="18"><tr><td valign="middle" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/profile.php?mode=viewprofile&u=4415&sid=8ff47b9f09da7fd9c5fead755dad38df"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_profile.gif" alt="View user's profile" title="View user's profile" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/privmsg.php?mode=post&u=4415&sid=8ff47b9f09da7fd9c5fead755dad38df"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_pm.gif" alt="Send private message" title="Send private message" border="0"/></a>     <script language="JavaScript" type="text/javascript"><![CDATA[<!--

	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row2"><span class="name"><a name="97859"/><b>rich_is_bored</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">a gun & a nice word<br/><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/avatars/upload/78944047442bf8d370f59a.gif" alt="" border="0"/><br/><br/>Joined: 11 Jan 2003<br/>Posts: 7163<br/>Location: Orlando, FL</span><br/></td>
		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=97859&sid=8ff47b9f09da7fd9c5fead755dad38df#97859"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Fri Jun 03, 2005 8:53 am<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=97859&sid=8ff47b9f09da7fd9c5fead755dad38df"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">Well if you have any intention of exporting that weapon to Doom 3 then you'd best forget all the special animation tools Lightwave affords you and stick to using bones because bone transformations are the only transformations that can be stored in a MD5anim.
<br/><br/>
Aside from that you'll probably need to merge all the layers aswell.<br/>_________________<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/" target="_blank" class="postlink"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/site/img/d3w.gif" border="0"/>  Staff</a>
<br/>
Learn something today? Why not write an article about it on <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.modwiki.net/wiki/Main_Page" target="_blank" class="postlink">modwiki.net</a>?</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row2" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=98026#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>

		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=97957&sid=8ff47b9f09da7fd9c5fead755dad38df#97957"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Fri Jun 03, 2005 11:05 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=97957&sid=8ff47b9f09da7fd9c5fead755dad38df"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">You don't need to animate with bones to use der_ton's general MD5 exporter, but that's for 3ds Max.<br/>_________________<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://trepaning.com/" target="_blank" class="postlink">Good Bye!</a></span><span class="gensmall"/></td>

		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=98011&sid=8ff47b9f09da7fd9c5fead755dad38df#98011"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Sat Jun 04, 2005 12:37 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=98011&sid=8ff47b9f09da7fd9c5fead755dad38df"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">I'll be using bones for the rope, but the other movements like the bolt (that little thingy holding the rope taut) and the recoil movement of the crossbow itself, do I have to use bones too?</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>

	</tr><tr><td class="row2" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=98026#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>

post.author: BloodRayne
post.body:
Rayne wrote:
Ps: Blender it's the only free 3d app with md5 scripts that I can remember.. But it's the only 3D app that scares the hell out of me when I launch it and the layout pops up in front of me..ug

There's also Gmax, which is free, based on 3d studio max and has an md5 exporter.

post.author: Rayne
post.body:
Great, good to know.. Actually, what is the workflow to create a Lightwave script, or a general converter? Maybe Rich can answer that to me..

It' not the syntax things that makes me worried, it's the mathematical aspect.. I really can barely do 5+5 = 12.. Ops, 10, I mean, 10...

post.author: Oneofthe8devilz
post.body:
Is there a way to attach a sound sapeaker to a md5's origin bone ?

I have a scene where a f-16 jet is flying through the level (animated in 3dsmax and exported to md5) and I would like to add some jet engine sounds to it that move with the jet....... just binding the speaker to the model-entity's name didn't do the trick since the entity itself is not moving .........

Thanks for some suggestions in advance

post.author: SnoopJeDi
post.body:
I'm a dummy with models, but you could probably create an invisible func_mover, bind the speaker to that, and move it to sync up with the anim.

There's probably a way to bind the speaker though, since there is a way to bind the flashlight to a zombie's hand.

post.author: BloodRayne
post.body:
Oneofthe8devilz wrote:
Is there a way to attach a sound sapeaker to a md5's origin bone ?


You don't need to, since it's an entity you can just call the sound from the animation def. An example:

Code:
model model_myf16 {
   mesh   models/md5/my_f16.md5mesh

   anim fly   models/md5/my_f16_fly.md5anim {
                frame 1   sound_body snd_fly
   }


snd_fly is then just a sounddecls you can define anywhere as soundshader.

post.author: Oneofthe8devilz
post.body:
Quote:
You don't need to, since it's an entity you can just call the sound from the animation def. An example:

Code:

model model_myf16 {
mesh models/md5/my_f16.md5mesh

anim fly models/md5/my_f16_fly.md5anim {
frame 1 sound_body snd_fly
}



snd_fly is then just a sounddecls you can define anywhere as soundshader.



Actually I got it working by looking closer at the "cinematics.def" file a couple of hours ago..... I was just so amazed by the fact that I got it working that I forgot to post you guys ........

Still thanks for that quick response bloodrayne ......

That's how I solved the problem:


Code:
model f16_jet {
   mesh      models/chris_md5/f16_jet.md5mesh   
   anim f16flyby   models/chris_md5/f16_jet.md5anim {
   frame 1      sound f16_jet_engine
   }
}

entityDef f16_jet {      
      "inherit"   "func_animate"
      "model"      "f16_jet"
}


"f16_jet_engine" is a looped soundshader that starts to play at frame 1 and gets played by the origin bone by default.... you can also define in the entity which bone shall play the sound.........

So once started it plays it infinitive times back......

I hope this might wind up useful for other ppl aswell......

post.author: bad marine ass
post.body:
Ok guys I have a bit of a problem with animation. My knowledge is almost at 0, but I understand in theory how it works

Take a look at this screenshot


Now what I want to do is to make the trigger move. The tension of the rope is released and the rope is moved forward, and then the bolt will also move forward with lightning speed and push the bolt (which isnt present in the screenshot) out of the crossbow

I have 2 questions:

1) my crossbow is made up of 7-8 different layers of parts ie. trigger in one layer, handle in one layer etc, do I need to combine them?
2) How do I actually get the crossbow to behave in the above-mentioned way? Any help will be appreciated. I've been reading the tutorials, and I've heard of the motion mixer plugin and stuff like that, but I'm very confused as to how I should get myself orientated and started with this

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body:
Well if you have any intention of exporting that weapon to Doom 3 then you'd best forget all the special animation tools Lightwave affords you and stick to using bones because bone transformations are the only transformations that can be stored in a MD5anim.

Aside from that you'll probably need to merge all the layers aswell.

post.author: Brain Trepaning
post.body: You don't need to animate with bones to use der_ton's general MD5 exporter, but that's for 3ds Max.

post.author: bad marine ass
post.body: I'll be using bones for the rope, but the other movements like the bolt (that little thingy holding the rope taut) and the recoil movement of the crossbow itself, do I have to use bones too?

post.author: der_ton
post.body: I think it's best if you try out the process of getting an animated model from LW into D3 with an example, instead of putting lots of time into animating your model with the wrong methods, walking down a long road just to see it's a dead end.

post.author: Fingernail
post.body:
Although we need animators (Dark Mod), we're probably not the MOST at need. We have a couple of people at least capable of animating, and we've got about three animations in on a couple of characters (walking, running, punching), but it's great to see the community recognising this "problem".

Depending on how things go, we may need your help, but with us it's a case of, we have a couple of people who CAN do animations, it's just that they also have a helluva lot of models to do and don't have the time to ONLY do animations, etc. etc. We're just about to go on a bit of an "advertising campaign" searching for animators, actually.

post.author: bad marine ass
post.body: Hmm it seems that the animations don't work the way I thought they should work. I thought it was something like Flash, whereby the polygons moved frame by frame. How exactly do the bones work? I'm halfway thru an animation tutorial, but I still don't quite get it

post.author: doomkid3000
post.body: you want to setup your bone skeleton with IK's in whatever program your using, so that when you animate your charactor its easy to manipulate the movements, without having to animate each bone making life alot easier

post.author: bad marine ass
post.body: So basically the weapons would work exactly like the characters do?

post.author: doomkid3000
post.body: i dont think so, unless you have some crazy weapon design that has a crazy type of animation, then YES

post.author: bad marine ass
post.body: which means that maya is the only way to animate weapons?

post.author: obihb
post.body:
You can animate your weapon in whatever program you can end up getting it into Doom3. I know of Maya and Max being able to do this. If Lightwave can do it then animate in that. The main thing to know is that anything you want to have animation on needs to be animated with bones. Nothing can be animated inside Doom3 with the old Quake3 method of blend verts.

So if you wanted to have the crossbow shoot an arrow, the string needs to be animated with bones, so does the arrow and the hand pulling the trigger and whatever else.

Within Max, the way der_ton's exporter work everything has to be a single mesh. You can't have the arrow a seperate mesh and soforth. Then it just has to be skinned and weighted on the bones you provide to animate each part. The exporter also allow you to use whatever tool is to your disposal like IK or constraints or directly animating it. All this is also possible from within Maya accept for the export to be a longer process and I don't think you have to have a single mesh. I'm sorry I have no experience with Lightwave.

post.author: bad marine ass
post.body:
Brian mentioned this in his reply to my query

Quote:
For the first question, it doesn't really matter a whole lot which
method you use to animate as long as the exported file contains only
bones.


Which means that the only way, the one and only way to animate, is through bones?

post.author: obihb
post.body:
Yes. It has to be bones.

Some confusion might come into some of the posts from Brian in some threads where he talks about der_ton's exporter being able to generate bones for you based on vertex movement. As far as I know it was an experimental exporter made by der_ton to make it possible for easier facial animation. It's not very "game" friendly though because it generates a bone per vertex which ends up being way too much.

The bottom line is that bones is the one and only method to animate in Doom3. Of course the scripted animation is possible on "solid" objects with simple translation and rotation that can be done, no "vertex level" animation like for characters.

post.body:
Yes. It has to be bones.

Some confusion might come into some of the posts from Brian in some threads where he talks about der_ton's exporter being able to generate bones for you based on vertex movement. As far as I know it was an experimental exporter made by der_ton to make it possible for easier facial animation. It's not very "game" friendly though because it generates a bone per vertex which ends up being way too much.

The bottom line is that bones is the one and only method to animate in Doom3. Of course the scripted animation is possible on "solid" objects with simple translation and rotation that can be done, no "vertex level" animation like for characters.

post.date: Posted: Sat Apr 08, 2006 11:51 pm Post subject: miscellaneous rig questions
post.author: Zergxes
post.body:
I have a few random questions about D3/Q4 rigs.

1.) what is the optimal number (or maybe just a good target number) of bones to keep things efficent for NPC monsters and for multiplayer characters?

2.) There are some 'floating' bones on some of the Q4 monster rigs that seem to translate around, particularly on the chest of the beserker. How are those set up?

3.) The rigs in Q4 use an inverted foot rig, should I stick to that or can I do the heel-less rig to save bones?

-Right now I'm just slamming out art for my portfolio but I would like to not back myself into a corner should I get the opportunity to get these in game.

Thanks in advance.

Anyway, I'm interested in getting back into the modding scene, and I'd like to make something look good for my showreel. Doom looks like it might be an excellent way to do so...
